ratings.comment: Professor Koenig always cares her student and lectures are somewhat helpful. However, her grading criteria is pretty vague and sometimes confusing. Suggestions are somewhat helpful but mostly so broad and confusing. She may deny some of her previous suggestions and tell you that it is not feasible after few days submitting your paper.

Jane is simply not fit to teach this class. Her feedback to my essays were to broad and often not helpful. She does not respond to her emails and is hardly accessible outside of the classroom. DON'T take her class; if she is the only instructor available, don't take this class that semester and defer taking it to the next semester if you can.

She is very kind and nice. She always cares about students' feelings and tries to give useful and great feedback. During the conference, she gives much effective advice and tries her best to improve our writing skills. After taking this course, I did learn more about how to effectively write an essay.

Worst instructor that I have ever met in UW Madison. I have never seen any professor who makes so much mistakes when giving us feedbacks during the conference. Also It makes me think that she is a huge populist. I got an A since I worked super hard but you will never expect easy grade in this class and plus dense hw. Avoid this class if you can.

Honestly, if you take a writing course, you are expected to stay up late for some days, and this is normal for a class like ESL 118. Jane is a very caring instructor and she gave me a lot of constructive feedback during conferences. She made me feel that ESL 118 is not as hard as other described and writing paper is a fun creative process.

Jane always tried to cheer us up. She's energetic and warm. Indeed this is a tough course and definitely hard to pass. But she gave a lot of comments though her handwriting can be a little bit ineligible. She also tried to extend the deadlines for a few days (which is lenient for 118) if we really couldn't finish our drafts.

If you really work hard, you can get an A as a Chinese student. Jane is not that tough on grade, compared to other ESL instructors. Most of her comment are helpful, and make sure follow them although sometimes you assume you are the right one. Honestly, the most important thing in writing is to write and revise again and again by yourself.

Jane is nice. If you have questions, you can email her. You will feel comfortable  during the class. However, if you write a bad essay, she will give you a low grade. She will give you a lot of suggestions for draft 2, and most of them are helpful. Be careful to revise the essay as she want, and you will have a high grade.

She's a kind woman and teach good in class. But she only tell us where we did wrong like "you need more evidence" "your evidence is not appropriate" "your margins are too big". She never told us the right way of writing but only tell her worries. If you have other choices better not take her section.

Had her for a pronunciation module of TESOL workshops. Really energetic and enthusiastic. Kept everyone engaged. Practical and applicable material, lots of ideas for activities and techniques to use later in your career. Class is pass/fail, so you just need to put forth reasonable effort and you'll do fine.
She is okay among ESL instructors. The course is hard but the grading is passable.

She is pretty okay in class, but her comments on paper is not helpful and very unclear. She will definitely pissed you off many times along the semester. If she is your only choice....good luck..........poor you
